snomtools.data.imports package¶

Submodules¶

snomtools.data.imports.lumerical_mat module¶

snomtools.data.imports.lumerical_mat.Efield_3d(filepath, first_coord='l', second_coord='x', third_coord='y', first_unit='m', second_unit='m', third_unit='m')[source]¶

Reads a matlab file where the electric field of a frequency domain monitor stored in a grid coordinate system of three coordinates. The components Ex, Ey, Ez and the Intensity E^2 are included. CAUTION! The right order of the axes cannot be checked. This means the coordinates have to be given in the same order as the corresponding values are stored in the electric field arrays!

Parameters:
  • filepath – String: The (absolute or relative) path of input file.
  • first_coord – String: The label of the first coordinate, by default ‘x’.
  • second_coord – String: The label of the second coordinate, by default ‘y’.
  • third_coord – String: The label of the third coordinate, by default ‘l’ (for lambda).
Returns:

The DataSet instance.

snomtools.data.imports.tiff module¶

This scripts imports tiff files, as generated for example by Terra and the PEEM Camera Software. The methods defined here will read those files and return the data as a DataSet instances. 3D tiff stacks shall be supported.

snomtools.data.imports.tiff.dummy_folder_peem_camera_terra(folderpath, h5target=True, verbose=False)[source]¶

Convenience shortcut method for dummy device scans with camera. Calls measurement_folder_peem_terra with correct parameters. See: measurement_folder_peem_terra()

snomtools.data.imports.tiff.dummy_folder_peem_dld_terra(folderpath, h5target=True, verbose=False)[source]¶

Convenience shortcut method for dummy device scans with dld. Calls measurement_folder_peem_terra with correct parameters. See: measurement_folder_peem_terra()

snomtools.data.imports.tiff.is_tif(filename)[source]¶

Checks if a filename is a tifffile.

Parameters:filename (str) – The filename.
Return type:bool
snomtools.data.imports.tiff.measurement_folder_peem_terra(folderpath, detector='dld', pattern='D', scanunit='um', scanfactor=1, scanaxislabel='scanaxis', scanaxispl=None, h5target=True, verbose=False)[source]¶

The base method for importing terra scan folders. Covers all scan possibilities, so far only in 1D scans.

Parameters:
  • folderpath (str) – The path of the folder containing the scan data. Example: “/path/to/measurement/1. Durchlauf”
  • detector (str) –

    Read mode corresponding to the used detector. Valid inputs:

    • "dld"
    • "camera"
  • pattern (str) –

    The pattern in the filenames that indicates the scan enumeration and is followed by the number indicating the position, according to the device used for the scan. Terra uses:

    • "D" for a delay stage
    • "R" for the rotation mount
    • "N" for a dummy device.
  • scanunit (str) – A valid unit string, according to the physical dimension that was scanned over.
  • scanfactor (float) –

    A factor that the numbers in the filenames need to be multiplied with to get the real value of the scan point in units of scanunit. This would be for example:

    • 0.2 (because of stage position) with delayunit "um" for normal Interferometer because one decimal is in filenames.
    • 0.2 (because of stage position and strange factor 10 in filenames) with delayunit "as" for PR interferometer
  • scanaxislabel (str) – A label for the axis of the scan.
  • scanaxispl (str) – A plot label for the axis of the scan.
  • h5target (str or h5py.Group or True, optional) – The HDF5 target to write to.
  • verbose (bool) – Flag to print progress to stdout.
Returns:

Imported DataSet.
Return type:

DataSet
snomtools.data.imports.tiff.peem_camera_read(filepath, mode='camware')[source]¶

Reads a PEEM image dataset aquired with the camera. Shadows the different readin functions for the different measurement programs and returns the generated DataSets.

Parameters:
  • filepath – String: The (absolute or relative) path of the input file.
  • mode – String: The readin mode. Valid options are “terra” for a tiff generated with Terra, “camware” for a tiff generated with the PCO CamWare Software (default) or “pne” for a tiff generated with the Focus ProNanoESCA Software.
Returns:

The generated DataSet.
snomtools.data.imports.tiff.peem_camera_read_camware(filepath)[source]¶

Reads a tif file as generated by the Camera Software (PCO Camware) when using the Camera. Therefore, the 2D tif dimensions are interpreted as x and y.

Parameters:filepath – String: The (absolute or relative) path of input file.
Returns:The dataset instance generated from the tif file.
snomtools.data.imports.tiff.peem_camera_read_terra(filepath)[source]¶

Reads a PEEM image aquired with the Camera and saved with Terra. For now, this just shadows the peem_camera_read_camware function, because they work the same way, this can be changed in the future, maybe to read addidional metadata generated by Terra.

Parameters:filepath – String: The (absolute or relative) path of the input file.
Returns:The generated DataSet.
snomtools.data.imports.tiff.peem_dld_read(filepath, mode='terra')[source]¶

Reads a time-resolved dld dataset. Shadows the different readin functions for the different measurement programs and returns the generated DataSets.

Parameters:
  • filepath – String: The (absolute or relative) path of the input file or folder.
  • mode – String: The readin mode. Valid options are “terra” for a tiff generated with Terra (default), “pne” for a folder of tiffs generated with the Focus ProNanoESCA Software.
Returns:

The generated DataSet.
snomtools.data.imports.tiff.peem_dld_read_terra(filepath)[source]¶

Reads a tif file as generated by Terra when using the DLD. Therefore, the 3D tif dimensions are interpreted as time-channel, x and y, with the first two time channels being the sum and the error image, which will be ignored.

Parameters:filepath – String: The (absolute or relative) path of input file.
Returns:The dataset instance generated from the tif file.
snomtools.data.imports.tiff.powerlaw_folder_peem_camera(folderpath, pattern='mW', powerunit=None, powerunitlabel=None)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • folderpath – The (relative or absolute) path of the folders containing the powerlaw measurement series.
  • pattern – string: A pattern the powers in the filenames are named with. For example in the default case “mW”, the filename containing ‘50,2mW’ or ‘50.2mW’ or ‘50.2 mW’ would accord to a power of 50.2 milliwatts. The power units for the axis quantities are also cast from this pattern if not explicitly given with powerunit.
  • powerunit – A valid unit string that will be cast as the unit for the power axis values. If not given, the pattern parameter will be cast as unit.
  • powerunitlabel – string: Will be used as the unit for the power axis plotlabel. Can be for example a LaTeX siunitx command. If not given, the powerunit parameter will be used.
Returns:

The dataset containing the images stacked along a power axis.
snomtools.data.imports.tiff.powerlaw_folder_peem_dld(folderpath, pattern='mW', powerunit=None, powerunitlabel=None)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • folderpath – The (relative or absolute) path of the folders containing the powerlaw measurement series.
  • pattern – string: A pattern the powers in the filenames are named with. For example in the default case “mW”, the filename containing ‘50,2mW’ or ‘50.2mW’ or ‘50.2 mW’ would accord to a power of 50.2 milliwatts. The power units for the axis quantities are also cast from this pattern if not explicitly given with powerunit.
  • powerunit – A valid unit string that will be cast as the unit for the power axis values. If not given, the pattern parameter will be cast as unit.
  • powerunitlabel – string: Will be used as the unit for the power axis plotlabel. Can be for example a LaTeX siunitx command. If not given, the powerunit parameter will be used.
Returns:

The dataset containing the images stacked along a power axis.

Searches for a tag in all pages of a tiff file and returns the first match as

  • tag_id (str) – The ID of the tag to search for.
Returns:

The tag object.
Return type:

tifffile.TiffTag
snomtools.data.imports.tiff.tr_folder_peem_camera_terra(folderpath, delayunit='um', delayfactor=0.2, delayunitlabel=None, h5target=True, verbose=False, **kwargs)[source]¶

Imports a Terra time scan folder that was measured by scanning the time steps in an interferometer while using the Camera.

Parameters:
  • folderpath (str) – The path of the folder containing the scan data. Example: “/path/to/measurement/1. Durchlauf”
  • delayunit (str) –

    A valid unit string, according to the physical dimension that was scanned over. Typically, this is:

    • :code:`“um” Micrometers for the normal Interferometer.
    • "as" Attoseconds for the phase resolved interferometer.
  • delayfactor (float) – A factor that the numbers in the filenames need to be multiplied with to get the real value of the scan point in units of delayunit. Typically for a time resolved measurement, this is 0.2 due to a decimal in the Terra file names, plus pulse delays are twice the stage position difference.
  • delayunitlabel (str) – A label for the delay axis. For example "\si{\atto\second}" if it’s a PSI measurement and plotting will be done with TeX typesetting.
  • h5target (str or h5py.Group or True, optional) – The HDF5 target to write to.
  • verbose (bool) – Flag to print progress to stdout.
Returns:

Imported DataSet.
Return type:

DataSet
snomtools.data.imports.tiff.tr_folder_peem_dld_terra(folderpath, delayunit='um', delayfactor=0.2, delayunitlabel=None, h5target=True, verbose=False, **kwargs)[source]¶

Imports a Terra time scan folder that was measured by scanning the time steps in an interferometer while using the Delaylinedetector (DLD).

Parameters:
  • folderpath (str) – The path of the folder containing the scan data. Example: “/path/to/measurement/1. Durchlauf”
  • delayunit (str) –

    A valid unit string, according to the physical dimension that was scanned over. Typically, this is:

    • :code:`“um” Micrometers for the normal Interferometer.
    • "as" Attoseconds for the phase resolved interferometer.
  • delayfactor (float) – A factor that the numbers in the filenames need to be multiplied with to get the real value of the scan point in units of delayunit. Typically for a time resolved measurement, this is 0.2 due to a decimal in the Terra file names, plus pulse delays are twice the stage position difference.
  • delayunitlabel (str) – A label for the delay axis. For example "\si{\atto\second}" if it’s a PSI measurement and plotting will be done with TeX typesetting.
  • h5target (str or h5py.Group or True, optional) – The HDF5 target to write to.
  • verbose (bool) – Flag to print progress to stdout.
Returns:

Imported DataSet.
Return type:

DataSet

Module contents¶

This module holds import scripts for data existing in common formats. It will read the data files and convert it to datasets defined in the parent module.
